remarks: Excluded middle law for closed subspaces, which is equivalent to (and derived from) the orthomodular law ~ dihoml4 .  Lemma 3.3(2) in [Holland95] p. 215.  In our proof, we use the variables ` X ` , ` M ` , ` p ` , ` q ` , ` r ` in place of Hollands' l, m, P, Q, L respectively. ( ~ pexmidALTN analog.)  (Contributed by NM, 15-Jan-2015.)
statement:
dochexmid.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dochexmid.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochexmid.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dochexmid.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
dochexmid.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` U ) $.
dochexmid.p $e |- .(+) = ( LSSum ` U ) $.
dochexmid.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dochexmid.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. S ) $.
dochexmid.c $e |- ( ph -> ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` X ) ) = X ) $.
dochexmid $p |- ( ph -> ( X .(+) ( ._|_ ` X ) ) = V ) $.
